poem:
### Surveillance

In the shadow of Buffalo,  
machinery hovers—  
a metal hawk with  
unblinking eyes.  
Deer scatter,  
skies hum in electronic whispers.  
Loretta, by the window, watches  
as pixels form a portrait,  
a neighbourhood  
under surveillance,  
wires tracing  
an uneasy geography  
of fear and flight.
